page.title: 09Houses of Horton
page.content: Housing in Horton is all of good quality and well maintained. There are houses from all periods from the late 17th Century onwards, including late 19th Century terraced cottages built for railway and quarry workers and a number of terraced and semidetached houses built during the first part of the 20th Century. Since 1945 a number of bungalows have been added some council built and some private. Most houses, except for some of the terraced cottages, have gardens. Many houses do not have garages. Everyone has an internal bathroom and toilet. Domestic heating is by open fires and/or central heating systems. There is no piped gas; users must rely on propane gas stored in tanks on the premises. One or two houses are converted from barns.
